hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Failed Breakout with Options Flow Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC attempts but fails to hold above key resistance (previous 30-day high) with put/call volume ratio >1.3 and negative gamma exposure increasing, the probability of transitioning to BEAR regime within 5 days exceeds 55%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts with options hedging activity indicate institutional positioning for downside. Negative gamma exposure creates reflexive selling pressure on declines.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 30-day high then closes back below it within 48 hours
Deribit BTC options put/call volume ratio > 1.3 for 2 consecutive days
Estimated gamma exposure turns negative (dealers short gamma)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confidence >60%) OR 10% price depreciation from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims and holds above 30-day high for 48 hours OR regime transitions to BULL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 45% of such signals fail to produce BEAR transition within 5 days across 2022-2024 neutral periods.
